1.text: Whoever loves correction loves knowledge, but he who hates reproof is stupid.

2.text: A good man shall obtain favor from Yahweh, but he will condemn a man of wicked devices.

3.text: A man shall not be established by wickedness, but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.

4.text: A worthy woman is the crown of her husband, but a disgraceful wife is as rottenness in his bones.

5.text: The thoughts of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.

6.text: The words of the wicked are about lying in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them.

7.text: The wicked are overthrown, and are no more, but the house of the righteous shall stand.

8.text: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom, but he who has a warped mind shall be despised.

9.text: Better is he who is lightly esteemed, and has a servant, than he who honors himself, and lacks bread.

10.text: A righteous man respects the life of his animal, but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

11.text: He who tills his land shall have plenty of bread, but he who chases fantasies is void of understanding.

12.text: The wicked desires the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes.

13.text: An evil man is trapped by sinfulness of lips, but the righteous shall come out of trouble.

14.text: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth. The work of a man’s hands shall be rewarded to him.

15.text: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but he who is wise listens to counsel.

16.text: A fool shows his annoyance the same day, but one who overlooks an insult is prudent.

17.text: He who is truthful testifies honestly, but a false witness lies.

18.text: There is one who speaks rashly like the piercing of a sword, but the tongue of the wise heals.

19.text: Truth’s lips will be established forever, but a lying tongue is only momentary.

20.text: Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil, but joy comes to the promoters of peace.

21.text: No mischief shall happen to the righteous, but the wicked shall be filled with evil.

22.text: Lying lips are an abomination to Yahweh, but those who do the truth are his delight.

23.text: A prudent man keeps his knowledge, but the hearts of fools proclaim foolishness.

24.text: The hands of the diligent ones shall rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.

25.text: Anxiety in a man’s heart weighs it down, but a kind word makes it glad.

26.text: A righteous person is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.

27.text: The slothful man doesn’t roast his game, but the possessions of diligent men are prized.

28.text: In the way of righteousness is life; in its path there is no death.
